desc: This course examines the process of literary development in English during two consecutive and contrasting movements: the Neoclassical (1660-1780) and Romantic (1780-1840) periods. Students read the works of representative and important writers from both periods, including Pope, Swift, Austen, Wordsworth, Blake, Shelley, Emerson, Douglass, and others, and examine the development of styles, conventions, andn forms in English, Irish, and American literatures. Prerequisite: FYW or equivalent. Offered periodically.
name: Neoclassic/Romantic Lit
prerequisites: Prerequisite: FYW or equivalent. Offered periodically.
title: Neoclassical and Romantic Literatures
